title: 107_hr3442
content: The Act may be cited as the "National Museum of African American History and Culture Plan for Action Presidential Commission Act of 2001". It establishes a commission. The National Museum of African American History and Culture Plan for Action Presidential Commission consists of up to 23 members appointed by the President, Speaker of the House, and Senate Majority Leader. Members are chosen from professional museum associations. The National Museum of African American History and Culture Plan for Action Presidential Commission includes members from professional museum associations, academic institutions, and groups dedicated to researching African American life, art, history, and culture. This encompasses Historically Black Colleges and Universities and the Joint Center for Political and Economic Studies. The National Museum of African American History and Culture Plan for Action Presidential Commission outlines the functions of the commission. The Commission will submit recommendations for the establishment and maintenance of the National Museum of African American History and Culture in Washington, D.C. They will convene a national conference on the Museum and develop fundraising plans for its creation and maintenance through contributions from the American people. The Commission will examine and report on various issues related to the establishment of the National Museum of African American History and Culture, including the availability and cost of collections, impact on regional museums, possible locations, conversion of the Arts and Industries Building, governance structure, and organizational operations. The Commission will submit a legislative plan to create and construct the Museum to relevant committees for consideration. SEC. 4. ADMINISTRATIVE PROVISIONS. The Secretary of the Interior will provide necessary administrative services, facilities, and funds for the Commission. Members not federal employees may receive compensation and travel expenses as determined by the Secretary. SEC. 5. Deadline for submission of reports; termination. The Commission must submit final reports and plans within 9 months of the Act's enactment and terminate within 30 days of submission. SEC. 6. Authorization of appropriations. $3,000,000 is authorized for Commission activities in fiscal year 2002.
